tool.name: fastp
tool.description: Fast all-in-one preprocessing for FastQ files
tool.command:
ln -s '$in1' input1.fq && #if str($single_paired.single_paired_selector) == 'paired': ln -s '$in2' input2.fq && #end if fastp -i input1.fq -o '$out1' #if str($single_paired.single_paired_selector) == 'paired': -I input2.fq -O '$out2' #end if
## adapter trimming options #if $single_paired.adapter_trimming_options.disable_adapter_trimming: $single_paired.adapter_trimming_options.disable_adapter_trimming #end if #if str($single_paired.adapter_trimming_options.adapter_sequence1): --adapter_sequence '$single_paired.adapter_trimming_options.adapter_sequence1' #end if #if str($single_paired.single_paired_selector) == 'paired': #if str($single_paired.adapter_trimming_options.adapter_sequence2): --adapter_sequence_r2 '$single_paired.adapter_trimming_options.adapter_sequence2' #end if #end if
## global trimming options #if str($single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_front1): -f $single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_front1 #end if #if str($single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_tail1): -t $single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_tail1 #end if #if str($single_paired.single_paired_selector) == 'paired': #if str($single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_front2): -F $single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_front2 #end if #if str($single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_tail2): -T $single_paired.global_trimming_options.trim_tail2 #end if #end if
## polyG tail trimming, useful for NextSeq/NovaSeq data #if str($polyG_tail_trimming.poly_g_min_len): --poly_g_min_len $polyG_tail_trimming.poly_g_min_len #end if #if $polyG_tail_trimming.trim_poly_g: $polyG_tail_trimming.trim_poly_g #else: #if $polyG_tail_trimming.disable_trim_poly_g: $polyG_tail_trimming.disable_trim_poly_g #end if #end if
## per read cutting by quality options #if $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_by_quality5 or $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_by_quality3:
#if $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_by_quality5: $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_by_quality5 #end if #if $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_by_quality3: $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_by_quality3 #end if
#if str($cutting_by_quality_options.cut_window_size): -W $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_window_size #end if #if str($cutting_by_quality_options.cut_mean_quality): -M $cutting_by_quality_options.cut_mean_quality #end if #end if
## quality filtering options #if $quality_filtering_options.disable_quality_filtering: $quality_filtering_options.disable_quality_filtering #else: #if str($quality_filtering_options.qualified_quality_phred): -q $quality_filtering_options.qualified_quality_phred #end if #if str($quality_filtering_options.unqualified_percent_limit): -u $quality_filtering_options.unqualified_percent_limit #end if #if str($quality_filtering_options.n_base_limit): -n $quality_filtering_options.n_base_limit #end if #end if
## length filtering options #if $length_filtering_options.disable_length_filtering: $length_filtering_options.disable_length_filtering #else: #if str($length_filtering_options.length_required): -l $length_filtering_options.length_required #end if #end if
## base correction by overlap analysis options #if $base_correction_options.correction: $base_correction_options.correction #end if
## UMI processing #if $umi_processing.umi: $umi_processing.umi #if str($umi_processing.umi_loc): --umi_loc '$umi_processing.umi_loc' #end if #if str($umi_processing.umi_len): --umi_len $umi_processing.umi_len #end if #if str($umi_processing.umi_prefix): --umi_prefix '$umi_processing.umi_prefix' #end if #end if
## overrepresented sequence analysis #if $overrepresented_sequence_analysis.overrepresentation_analysis: $overrepresented_sequence_analysis.overrepresentation_analysis #if str($overrepresented_sequence_analysis.overrepresentation_sampling): -P $overrepresented_sequence_analysis.overrepresentation_sampling #end if #end if
## thread options --thread \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1}

section.name: polyG_tail_trimming
section.title: PolyG tail trimming, useful for NextSeq/NovaSeq data

param.name: trim_poly_g
param.label: Trim polyG
param.help: Force polyG tail trimming, by default trimming is automatically enabled for Illumina NextSeq/NovaSeq data.

param.name: poly_g_min_len
param.label: PolyG minimum length
param.help: The minimum length to detect polyG in the read tail. 10 by default.

param.name: disable_trim_poly_g
param.label: Disable trim polyG
param.help: Disable polyG tail trimming, by default trimming is automatically enabled for Illumina NextSeq/NovaSeq data.

section.name: cutting_by_quality_options
section.title: Per read cutting by quality options

param.name: cut_by_quality5
param.label: Cut by quality in front (5')
param.help: Enable per read cutting by quality in front (5'), default is disabled (WARNING: this will interfere deduplication for both PE/SE data).

param.name: cut_by_quality3
param.label: Cut by quality in tail (3')
param.help: Enable per read cutting by quality in tail (3'), default is disabled (WARNING: this will interfere deduplication for SE data).

param.name: cut_window_size
param.label: Cutting window size
param.help: The size of the sliding window for sliding window trimming, default is 4.

param.name: cut_mean_quality
param.label: Cutting mean quality
param.help: The bases in the sliding window with mean quality below cutting_quality will be cut, default is Q20.

param.name: disable_quality_filtering
param.label: Disable quality filtering
param.help: Quality filtering is enabled by default. If this option is specified, quality filtering is disabled.

param.name: qualified_quality_phred
param.label: Qualified quality phred
param.help: The quality value that a base is qualified. Default 15 means phred quality >=Q15 is qualified.

param.name: unqualified_percent_limit
param.label: Unqualified percent limit
param.help: How many percents of bases are allowed to be unqualified (0~100). Default 40 means 40%.

param.name: n_base_limit
param.label: N base limit
param.help: If one read's number of N base is >n_base_limit, then this read/pair is discarded. Default is 5.

param.name: disable_length_filtering
param.label: Disable length filtering
param.help: Length filtering is enabled by default. If this option is specified, length filtering is disabled.

param.name: length_required
param.label: Length required
param.help: Reads shorter than this value will be discarded, default is 15.

section.name: base_correction_options
section.title: Base correction by overlap analysis options

param.name: correction
param.label: Enable base correction
param.help: Enable base correction in overlapped regions (only for PE data), default is disabled.

param.name: umi
param.label: Enable unique molecular identifer
param.help: Enable unique molecular identifer (UMI) preprocessing.

param.name: umi_loc
param.label: UMI location
param.help: Specify the location of UMI, can be (index1/index2/read1/read2/per_index/per_read, default is none.

param.name: umi_len
param.label: UMI length
param.help: If the UMI is in read1/read2, its length should be provided.

param.name: umi_prefix
param.label: UMI prefix
param.help: If specified, an underline will be used to connect prefix and UMI (i.e. prefix=UMI, UMI=AATTCG, final=UMI_AATTCG). No prefix by default.

param.name: overrepresentation_analysis
param.label: Enable overrepresented analysis
param.help: Enable overrepresented sequence analysis.

param.name: overrepresentation_sampling
param.label: Overrepresentation sampling
param.help: One in (--overrepresentation_sampling) reads will be computed for overrepresentation analysis (1~10000), smaller is slower, default is 20.

tool.help:
A tool designed to provide fast all-in-one preprocessing for FastQ files. This tool is developed in C++ with multithreading supported to afford high performance.
**features**
1. filter out bad reads (too low quality, too short, or too many N...)
2. cut low quality bases for per read in its 5' and 3' by evaluating the mean quality from a sliding window (like Trimmomatic but faster).
3. trim all reads in front and tail
4. cut adapters. Adapter sequences can be automatically detected,which means you don't have to input the adapter sequences to trim them.
5. correct mismatched base pairs in overlapped regions of paired end reads, if one base is with high quality while the other is with ultra low quality
6. preprocess unique molecular identifer (UMI) enabled data, shift UMI to sequence name.
7. report JSON format result for further interpreting.
8. visualize quality control and filtering results on a single HTML page (like FASTQC but faster and more informative).
9. split the output to multiple files (0001.R1.gz, 0002.R1.gz...) to support parallel processing. Two modes can be used, limiting the total split file number, or limitting the lines of each split file.
10. support long reads (data from PacBio / Nanopore devices).
This tool is being intensively developed, and new features can be implemented soon if they are considered useful. If you have any additional requirement for fastp, please file an issue:https://github.com/OpenGene/fastp/issues/new
